Morning Adhkar.description: When you say this in the morning, you have fulfilled your dhikr for the morning
Morning Adhkar.content: O Allah, by You we enter the morning and by You we enter the evening, by You we live and by You we die, and to You is the resurrection

Morning Adhkar.description: Whoever says this in the morning and evening and dies that night, he will enter Paradise
Morning Adhkar.content: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is none worthy of worship except You. You created me and I am Your servant, and I am faithful to my covenant and promise to You as much as I can. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I acknowledge Your favor upon me and I acknowledge my sin, so forgive me, for indeed none can forgive sins except You

Morning Adhkar.description: Whoever says this in the morning and evening, it becomes incumbent upon Allah to please him on the Day of Resurrection
Morning Adhkar.content: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace be upon him) as my Prophet

Morning Adhkar.description: Whoever says this, Allah will free him from the Fire
Morning Adhkar.content: O Allah, I have reached the morning and at this very time all of creation is testifying to You. O Allah, grant me a share of all the good that You cause to reach me in this day, and protect me from all the evil that You cause to reach me in this day

Morning Adhkar.description: Whoever says this, Allah will suffice him against his concerns in this world and the next
Morning Adhkar.content: Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne
In the name of Allah, with Whose name nothing can harm on earth or in heaven, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing

We have reached the morning and at this very time the dominion belongs to Allah. All praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent
Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His words
O Allah, protect me in my body, O Allah, protect me in my hearing, O Allah, protect me in my sight, there is none worthy of worship except You

Morning Adhkar.description: It will be equal to freeing ten slaves, and one hundred good deeds will be written for him, and one hundred bad deeds will be erased from him, and it will be a protection for him from Satan
Morning Adhkar.content: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent

Morning Adhkar.description: Ayat al-Kursi - Whoever recites it after every obligatory prayer, nothing will prevent him from entering Paradise except death
Morning Adhkar.content: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great

Morning Adhkar.description: Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad - Equivalent to one-third of the Qur'an
Morning Adhkar.content: Say, He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, Nor is there to Him any equivalent

Morning Adhkar.description: The Mu'awwidhatan - For protection from all evil
Morning Adhkar.content: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak, From the evil of that which He created, And from the evil of darkness when it settles, And from the evil of the blowers in knots, And from the evil of an envier when he envies

Morning Adhkar.description: The Mu'awwidhatan - For protection from all evil
Morning Adhkar.content: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer - Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind - From among the jinn and mankind

Morning Adhkar.description: Blessings upon the Prophet - Whoever sends blessings upon me ten times, Allah will send blessings upon him one hundred times
Morning Adhkar.content: O Allah, send prayers and peace and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad

Morning Adhkar.description: Seeking blessings for the new day
Morning Adhkar.content: O Allah, whatever blessing I or any of Your creation have reached this morning, it is from You alone, without partner, so for You is all praise and all thanks

Morning Adhkar.description: Comprehensive dua for forgiveness and well-being
Morning Adhkar.content: O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in this world and the next. O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in my religion, my worldly affairs, my family, and my wealth. O Allah, veil my weaknesses and set at ease my dismay. O Allah, preserve me from the front and from behind and on my right and on my left and from above, and I take refuge with You lest I be swallowed up by the earth

Morning Adhkar.description: Seeking Allah's protection and relying on Him
Morning Adhkar.content: O Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, Lord and Sovereign of all things, I testify that there is no deity except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil

Evening Adhkar.description: When you say this in the evening, you have fulfilled your dhikr for the evening
Evening Adhkar.content: O Allah, by You we enter the evening and by You we enter the morning, by You we live and by You we die, and to You is the resurrection

Evening Adhkar.description: Whoever says this in the morning and evening and dies that night, he will enter Paradise
Evening Adhkar.content: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is none worthy of worship except You. You created me and I am Your servant, and I am faithful to my covenant and promise to You as much as I can. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I acknowledge Your favor upon me and I acknowledge my sin, so forgive me, for indeed none can forgive sins except You

Evening Adhkar.description: Whoever says this in the morning and evening, it becomes incumbent upon Allah to please him on the Day of Resurrection
Evening Adhkar.content: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace be upon him) as my Prophet

Evening Adhkar.description: Whoever says this in the evening has fulfilled his gratitude for that day
Evening Adhkar.content: O Allah, whatever blessing has reached me or anyone of Your creation, it is from You alone, You have no partner, so for You is all praise and for You is all gratitude

Evening Adhkar.description: Whoever says this, Allah will suffice him against his concerns in this world and the next
Evening Adhkar.content: Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne

Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His words

Evening Adhkar.content: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent

Evening Adhkar.description: Ayat al-Kursi - Protection from Satan until morning
Evening Adhkar.content: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great

Evening Adhkar.content: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer - Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind - From among the jinn and mankind

Evening Adhkar.description: Blessings upon the Prophet - Whoever sends blessings upon me ten times, Allah will send blessings upon him one hundred times
Evening Adhkar.content: O Allah, send prayers and peace and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad

Evening Adhkar.description: We have reached the evening upon the fitrah of Islam
Evening Adhkar.content: We have reached the evening upon the fitrah of Islam, and the word of pure faith, and upon the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), and upon the religion of our father Ibrahim, a Muslim and of true faith, and he was not of the polytheists

Evening Adhkar.description: Comprehensive dua for forgiveness and well-being
Evening Adhkar.content: O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in this world and the next. O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in my religion, my worldly affairs, my family, and my wealth. O Allah, veil my weaknesses and set at ease my dismay. O Allah, preserve me from the front and from behind and on my right and on my left and from above, and I take refuge with You lest I be swallowed up by the earth

Post-Prayer Azkar.content: I seek forgiveness from Allah, I seek forgiveness from Allah, I seek forgiveness from Allah. O Allah, You are Peace and from You is peace, blessed are You, O Possessor of majesty and honor

None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. O Allah, none can withhold what You give and none can give what You withhold, and the fortune of a fortunate one cannot benefit him against You
Glory be to Allah, and praise be to Allah, and Allah is the Greatest
None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent

Post-Prayer Azkar.description: Ten times after Maghrib and Fajr
Post-Prayer Azkar.content: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise, He gives life and causes death and He is over all things omnipotent

Post-Prayer Azkar.description: After the greeting of Fajr prayer
Post-Prayer Azkar.content: O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, good provision, and accepted deeds
O Allah, protect me from the Fire

Post-Prayer Azkar.description: Seeking help for remembrance and gratitude
Post-Prayer Azkar.content: O Allah, help me to remember You, to thank You, and to worship You in the best manner

Post-Prayer Azkar.description: Ayat al-Kursi - Whoever recites it after every obligatory prayer, nothing will prevent him from entering Paradise except death
Post-Prayer Azkar.content: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great

Post-Prayer Azkar.description: Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad - Equivalent to one-third of the Qur'an
Post-Prayer Azkar.content: Say, He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, Nor is there to Him any equivalent

Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak, From the evil of that which He created, And from the evil of darkness when it settles, And from the evil of the blowers in knots, And from the evil of an envier when he envies

Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer - Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind - From among the jinn and mankind

O Allah, distance me from my sins just as You have distanced the East from the West, O Allah, purify me from my sins as a white robe is purified from filth, O Allah, cleanse me from my sins with snow, water, and ice

Tasbeeh.description: One thousand good deeds will be written for him or one thousand bad deeds will be erased from him
His sins will be erased even if they were like the foam of the sea
Tasbeeh.content: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him

Tasbeeh.description: They will fill what is between the heavens and the earth
Tasbeeh.content: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Allah

Tasbeeh.description: A palm tree will be planted for him in Paradise
Tasbeeh.content: Glory be to Allah, the Most Great, and praise be to Him

Tasbeeh.description: They are heavy in the scales and beloved to the Most Merciful
Tasbeeh.content: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him, Glory be to Allah, the Most Great

Tasbeeh.description: It will be equal to freeing ten slaves, and one hundred good deeds will be written for him, and one hundred bad deeds will be erased from him
Tasbeeh.content: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent

Tasbeeh.description: A treasure from the treasures of Paradise
Tasbeeh.content: There is no might and no power except with Allah

Tasbeeh.description: It will fill the scales of the servant with good deeds
Tasbeeh.content: All praise is for Allah, Lord of the worlds

Tasbeeh.description: Whoever sends blessings upon the Prophet in the morning and evening, my intercession will reach him on the Day of Resurrection
Tasbeeh.content: O Allah, send prayers and peace and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad

Tasbeeh.description: Following the example of the Prophet (peace be upon him)

Azkar Before Sleep.content: In Your name, my Lord, I lie down and in Your name I rise, so if You should take my soul then have mercy upon it, and if You should return my soul then protect it in the manner You do so with Your righteous servants

O Allah, You created my soul and You will take its life, to You belongs its life and death. If You should keep my soul alive then protect it, and if You should take its life then forgive it. O Allah, I ask You for well-being

Azkar Before Sleep.description: Seeking protection from the punishment of the grave
Azkar Before Sleep.content: O Allah, protect me from Your punishment on the day You resurrect Your servants
In Your name, O Allah, I die and I live

Azkar Before Sleep.description: Ayat al-Kursi - Protection from Satan until morning
Azkar Before Sleep.content: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great

Azkar Before Sleep.description: Reciting Surah Al-Ikhlas and the Mu'awwidhatan
Azkar Before Sleep.content: Say, He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, Nor is there to Him any equivalent

Azkar Before Sleep.description: Reciting Surah Al-Ikhlas and the Mu'awwidhatan
Azkar Before Sleep.content: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak, From the evil of that which He created, And from the evil of darkness when it settles, And from the evil of the blowers in knots, And from the evil of an envier when he envies

Azkar Before Sleep.description: Reciting Surah Al-Ikhlas and the Mu'awwidhatan
Azkar Before Sleep.content: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer - Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind - From among the jinn and mankind

Azkar Before Sleep.description: Dua for protection when going to sleep
Azkar Before Sleep.content: O Allah, I submit my soul unto You, and I entrust my affair unto You, and I turn my face toward You, and I totally rely on You, in hope and fear of You. Verily there is no refuge nor safe haven from You except with You. I believe in Your Book which You have revealed and in Your Prophet whom You have sent

Azkar Before Sleep.description: The last two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah - They will suffice him against all evil
Azkar Before Sleep.content: The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying], We make no distinction between any of His messengers. And they say, We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination. Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people

Azkar Upon Waking.content: All praise is for Allah who gave us life after causing us to die and unto Him is the resurrection
All praise is for Allah who restored to me my health and returned my soul and permitted me to remember Him

Azkar Upon Waking.description: Monotheism and seeking forgiveness upon waking
Azkar Upon Waking.content: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. Glory be to Allah, and praise be to Allah, and none has the right to be worshipped except Allah and Allah is the Greatest, and there is no might and no power except with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great. My Lord, forgive me

None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. All praise is for Allah, and glory be to Allah, and none has the right to be worshipped except Allah, and Allah is the Greatest, and there is no might and no power except with Allah, then he said: O Allah, forgive me

Azkar Upon Waking.description: Dua for wiping sleep from the face
Azkar Upon Waking.content: O Allah, the stars have disappeared, the eyes have slept, and You are Ever-Living, Self-Subsisting, neither slumber nor sleep overtakes You. O Ever-Living, O Self-Sustaining, grant me a peaceful night and put my eyes to sleep
All praise is for Allah Who has honored me with this good dream

Quranic Duas.description: The most comprehensive dua from the Qur'an
Quranic Duas.content: Our Lord, grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter and protect us from the punishment of the Fire
Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people

Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people
Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower

Quranic Duas.description: Dua for forgiveness and protection from Fire
Quranic Duas.content: Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire
My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication
My Lord, increase me in knowledge
There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers

Quranic Duas.description: Dua for righteous spouses and offspring
Quranic Duas.content: Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous
My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small
Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful
Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision
Our Lord, remove us from this city of wrongdoing people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Adam (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Nuh (Noah) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer and from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication. Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Musa (Moses) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: My Lord, expand for me my breast and ease for me my task and untie the knot from my tongue that they may understand my speech

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Ayyub (Job) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Sulayman (Solomon) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Zakariyya (Zechariah) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Yusuf (Joseph) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: My Lord, You have given me [something] of sovereignty and taught me of the interpretation of dreams. Creator of the heavens and earth, You are my protector in this world and in the Hereafter. Cause me to die a Muslim and join me with the righteous

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Al-Khidr (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Isma'il (Ishmael) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing

Prophets' Duas.description: Dua of Prophet Harun (Aaron) (peace be upon him)
Prophets' Duas.content: My Lord, expand for me my breast and ease for me my task and untie the knot from my tongue that they may understand my speech
